clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Unfavorable Histological Features on the Oncological Outcomes of Colon Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Unfavorable Histological Features on the Oncological Outcomes of Colon Cancer

collaborator.agency: Sixth Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-sen University
Koo Foundation Sun Yat-Sen Cancer Center

brief_summary.textblock: To explore the effect of unfavorable histological features on the clinical outcomes of patients receiving radical resection of colon cancer.

primary_outcome.description: The time from the time of surgery to the time of recurrence or death from any cause, calculated on a monthly basis, with the most recent recurrence and metastasis.

secondary_outcome.description: The time from the time of surgery to the time of recurrence or death from any cause, calculated on a monthly basis.

intervention.description: The patients with colon cancer will receive radical surgery. Adjuvant chemotherapy will be given according to the results of postoperative histological results.

study_pop.textblock: Colon cancer patients with or without unfavorable histological features

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data can be shared with all researchers involved in the study.
